revised_title: Exploiting High Strengths in Engineering Materials Based on Brittle Solids
tldr: The author discusses the design of engineering materials based on brittle solids, focusing on the exploitation of high strengths in these materials. They explore the use of continuous fibers, fiber packing, and bonding to achieve high-performance materials. The author also considers the advantages and limitations of using refractory fibers and the importance of understanding fracture mechanisms for future advancements.
